item.title: New in Nikola v6 part I: Typography
item.dc:creator: Mathieu Clabaut
item.description:
I am plan­ning to do a ma­jor re­lease (ver­sion 6!) of Ni­ko­la my sta­tic blog and site ge­ne­ra­tor the next wee­kend. It's a ma­jor ver­sion be­cause the­re ­has been a ton of fea­ture work done. So, I will do a quick se­ries high­ligh­ting some of ­those im­pro­ve­ments this week.

Today's Topic: Typography.

Ni­ko­la used to suck at this. It pro­du­ced sites like most web­si­tes: ab­so­lute gar­ba­ge w­hen it came to ty­po­gra­phy. So, we fixed it.

Here is what a cer­tain sec­tion of A Stu­dy in Scar­let loo­ked like when built using Ni­ko­la 5.5.1 (the cur­rent re­lea­se):
